page.title: 01Principal Features of Frome
page.content: FROME is a market town in Somerset. It is the fourth largest town in Somer set & was founded in 685 by St. Aldhelm. It has grown a lot since then and is now the 4th. largest town in Somerset with about 20,000 people. The industry in Frome used to be cloth making but now that has been replaced by light engineering, carpet making, printing and others. In 1985 we celebrate Frome 1300 with many events. Frome has a weekly market, but the Council has plans to move it away from the town centre. There are market stalls in the Market Place every Wednesday & Saturday. Frome is twinned with Murrhardt in Germany and Chateau Gontier in France. The oldest part of Frome is medieval Cheap St. & the Trinity area (1670- l720) with 6 streets of houses is interesting. Ann White (10)
